docs.text: since 1990 , the dramatic picture has undergone a certain change of style .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: now , instead of emphasizing feel-good stories replete with characters of noble virtues , the screenplays and direction point toward human struggle and sorrow .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: this realist tendancy can be inspiring at times , as 1993's schindler's list shows .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: most of today's mainstream drama , however , creates an overabundance of emoting that can turn off members of the audience .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: that's why pictures like october sky , which are a throwback to the good ol' dramas of yesteryear , are such a welcome relief in contemporary cinema .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the movie is based on the true story of homer hickam ( jake gyllenhaal ) , a teenager in the 1950's company town of coalwood , west virginia .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it's a well-known fact that the only boys to make a name for themselves are the ones that get out of the town on football scholarships ; the rest grow up to work in the coal mine .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the mine , which is run by homer's father ( chris cooper ) , is not the place for homer , however .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: after watching the soviet satellite sputnik shoot across the october sky in 1957 , homer feels a connection with the outside world -- as he puts it , " anyone in the world could look up and see the same thing i did . "
docs.label: positive

docs.text: drafting two of his best friends and the brainiac outcast , homer begins to construct rockets .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: with the help of their history teacher , miss riley ( laura dern ) , and several mine workers , the four are soon bound for great things .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: october sky is a skillfully crafted film , and most of that credit must go to director joe johnston .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: johnston -- whose career in the film industry includes everything from directing well-known titles like jumanji and the rocketeer down to an uncredited role as a death star trooper in star wars -- certainly knows what he's doing here .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he molds characters which are true to life and also fun to watch into a plot that is straightforward and robust .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he does not push any barriers , but instead adopts a conservative style of filmmaking which enhances the film's charm .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: his finesse brings out elements which might otherwise be lost -- such as the relationships between homer and various mine workers , or the silent struggle between homer's mother and father .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the cast is well chosen , although the true bright spots are the supporting roles .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: laura dern ( jurassic park ) lends a strong performance in the role of the history teacher , giving the boys the support and guidance they need .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: her role is instantly likeable .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: chris cooper ( the horse whisperer ) , as homer's father , is less likeable -- even downright despicable at times -- but his turn here gives gravity to the movie .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he's definitely a driving force in homer's life , and his more humane moments give the piece a certain dynamic that is commendable .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the script is generally cheerful , projecting the boys' endeavors in a lighthearted manner .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: there are moments when it becomes predictable -- such as the train tracks scene -- and there are moments when it sacrifices orginality for the need to come up with an emotional plot twist .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it highlights the essence of youth , however , and for its exceptional job at this it can be forgiven other missteps .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: october sky should be a success with audiences .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: although it doesn't have the appeal of current teen flicks like varsity blues or she's all that , it certainly holds an undeniable quality that older crowds will lean towards .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it's a welcome change to the dramatic genre , and one that everyone should see .
docs.label: positive
